column4: i am trying to install ubuntu Feisty but i am locked at partitioning , i have also xp on my hard drive but there is no other partition for ubuntu but there is a space in c: like 8 gb. so i want to use that empty space. In partition window there is a selection "Guided: resize sda and use freed space" does that mean it will use that free space?
_mikem, well i just want to know what does that mean?
wubi will install your linux filesystem in a file that resides in your windows partition, thereby bypassing the risks associated with partitioning
